answers.author: Pamela Muse
answers.text:
Check out the Alliance/ICMA Job Center at wwww.transformgov.org and click on Job Center

answers.author: Jesse Himes
answers.text:
Hi Shamima,​
Great question! Finding employment in the field that someone recently graduated from is seemingly impossible. 
Similar questions have been asked by several other users. I think this question had a few great responses.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/kn/Question/20323​
ICMA's PM Magazine posted an article in June that asked local government professionals "What pointers would you give recent graduates?" Check out their answers.
http://icma.org/en/press/pm_magazine/article/104498
ICMA's Career Network is full of resources to get you on the right path to becoming a local government professional. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/career_network/home
Hope this helped!
Jesse Himes, Knowledge Network Intern, jhimes@icma.org

author: Shamima J
text:
Looking for an entry level position. May I request the honorable members to provide information about opportunities available in their jurisdiction?
I have a Bachelor of Urban and Rural Planning degree and a Master of Public Administration degree.  I have couple of years of work experience and significantly high number of skill sets. Now the question is - should I consider some certifications? If yes, what are those? 
I would like to be connected to you via linkedin. My profile link - www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=261063070&trk=nav_responsive_tab_profile
Thank you.
title: How to get one's foot in the door?
